net.xuset.objectIO.netObj

Class NetFunc

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.netObj.AbstractNetObject
      • net.xuset.objectIO.netObj.NetFunc
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetObject

    public class NetFunc
extends AbstractNetObject
    NetFunc allows functionality to be serialized and deserialized. A NetFunc object could be thought of as a 'function' that can be 'called' through the serialization.

    To 'call the NetFunc', use the method sendCall(MarkupMsg); the given MarkupMsg object are the 'arguments' for the 'function call'. After that, the NetFunc needs to serialize it's updates. When the updates are deserialized, the 'function call' is executed by calling NetFuncListener.funcCalled(MarkupMsg) with the 'function argument' as the argument.

    If the 'function call' returns a MarkupMsg object. That message is thought of as the 'return value' for the 'function call'. This 'return value' is included the NetFunc's updates. When the updates are deserialized, NetFuncListener.funcReturned(MarkupMsg) is called with the 'return value' as the argument.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    NetFuncListener, MarkupMsg

      • NetFunc

        public NetFunc(java.lang.String id,
       NetFuncListener listener)
        Creates the NetFunc instance with the given id and listener. The given listener is used when a 'function call' or 'function return' is deserialized.
        Parameters:
        id - the id that will be returned by getId()
        listener - the listener used for 'calls' and 'returns'

      • serializeToMsg

        public MarkupMsg serializeToMsg()
        This method only returns an empty MarkupMsg object.
        Returns:
        an empty MarkupMsg object

      • deserializeMsg

        public void deserializeMsg(MarkupMsg msg)
        Description copied from interface: NetObject
        Deserialize the given MarkupMsg object. The entire state of the NetObject does not have to be present in the given MarkupMsg object for this method to work correctly. It can take a partial or complete state and update itself accordingly.

      • hasUpdates

        public boolean hasUpdates()
        Description copied from interface: NetObject
        Indicates if the objects state has changed since the last call to serializeUpdates().
        Returns:
        true if the object has changed and can be updated.

      • serializeUpdates

        public MarkupMsg serializeUpdates()
        Description copied from interface: NetObject
        This method only serializes the state that has changed since the last call to this method. serializeToMsg() converts the entire state into a MarkupMsg object but this method converts only what has changed since the last call. This method is significantly more bandwidth friendly than serializeToMsg(). If the object has not changed since the last call, an empty MarkupMsg object is returned.
        Returns:
        the updated and partial state of the object as a MarkupMsg object
